com.jacobschneider.engine.math.boundingvolumes

Interface OverlapStrategy


  • public interface OverlapStrategy
    An interface for an overlap strategy. An overlap strategy contains an algorithm for testing whether two bounding volumes intersect. Implementations of this interface should be stateless and added to to BoundVolume.putStrategy(OverlapStrategy). Every unique possible BoundVolumePair MUST have a corresponding implementation of this interface.
    Author:
    Jacob

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BoundVolumePair getVolumePair()
      The set of two BoundVolume types that this implementation handles.
      boolean testOverlap(BoundVolume vol1, BoundVolume vol2)
      Determines whether two bounding volumes intersect.

    • Method Detail

      • testOverlap

        boolean testOverlap(BoundVolume vol1,
                    BoundVolume vol2)
        Determines whether two bounding volumes intersect. When this is called by the engine the arguments are guaranteed to match the types returned by getVolumePair() The order the arguments are input do not matter (reflexive).
        Parameters:
        vol1 - - First volume to compare.
        vol2 - - Second volume to compare.
        Returns:
        - Whether an intersection has occurred.

      • getVolumePair

        BoundVolumePair getVolumePair()
        The set of two BoundVolume types that this implementation handles.
        Returns:
        - A BoundVolumePair object that contains these two types.
